questiontext.text: Threshold values of International Association of Diabetes and Pregnancy Study Group Consensus Panel for diagnosis of gestational diabetes mellitus
Which of these statements is true about diabetic retinopathy?

answer.text: Retinal deteriotation may occur during pregnancy in patients who have background retinopathy before pregnancy
Diabetic patients with no evidence of retinopathy before pregnancy could get rid of developing retinopathy during pregnancy
All patients with active proliferative retinopathy in pregnancy should undergo cesarean delivery in order to avoid the risk of vitreous hemorrhage related to vaginal delivery
Poor glycemic control does not respond to progression of diabetic retinopathy in pregnancy

questiontext.text: Which of the following findings are considered diagnostics for overt diabetes in pregnancy?

answer.text: Fasting plasma glucose  equal to or greater than 120 mg/dl
Random plasma glucose equal to or greater than 200 mg/dl

questiontext.text: Compare to women without diabetes, which fetal condition occurs more often in the setting of pregestational diabetes?

A 23 year old G1P0 at 38 weeks gestation, delivered a 3,9 kg baby vaginally. Upon delivery of the placenta, there was notes to be an inverted uterus, which was successfully managed including replacement of the uterus. Which of the following placental implantation sites would most likely predispose to an inverted uterus ?

A 25 year old patient tell her doctor that she wants to have a child in the next few year. She is concerned as she has seizure disorder and taken valproic acid. It has been 1 year since her last seizure and she has heard that seizures are dangerous for the fetus. 2. Which of the following antiseizure medication, when taken as monotherapy, is associated with the highest of major congenital malformation ?

A 29 year old G2P1 at 28 weeks gestation, who had normal hemoglobin level 4 weeks ago at her first prenatal visit complains of 1 week of fatique and now has hemoglobin level of 7,0 g/dL She noted dark colored urine after taking an antibiotic for urinary tract infection. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis ?

A 39-year-old G2P1001 presents at 18–5/7 weeks’ gestation for her scheduled fetal anatomic survey. During the examination, the fetal anatomy is noted to be normal, but the cervical length is measured at 15 mm. Despite counseling about the lack of consistent data showing a benefit in this setting, the patient requests that a cervical cerclage be placed. Which of the following, if present, would be considered an absolute contraindication to cervical cerclage placement?

answer.text: Prolapse of fetal membranes into the vagina

questiontext.text: A monochorionic twin pregnancy showed a discordant crown–lump length (CRL) at 12 weeks gestation, and a discordant amniotic fluid volume at 15 weeks with a deepest vertical pocket of 1.8 cm in the smaller twin and 6.3 cm in the larger twin. Both bladders are visible. Which of the following is/are likely diagnosis(es)?

answer.text: Twin-to-twin transfusion syndrome Quintero Stage II.
Complicated monochorionic twin pregnancy, suspected to develop either selective fetal growth restriction or twin–twin transfusion syndrome (TTTS).
Velamentous cord insertion in one twin.

questiontext.text: A patient presents for her first prenatal visit at 10 weeks’ gestation. Her routine prenatal intake laboratory tests reveal that she is not immune to rubella. What should you recommend?
Chorioamnionitis (intra-amniotic infection) is typically caused by which of the following organisms?
Congenital syndromes related to viral infections are most likely to occur if the mother contracts the illness during which of the following trimesters?
Intakes of vitamin A during pregnancy have not been associated with birth defects when it is given in doses ?
Maternal deficiency of vitamin D has been associated with which of the following complications in the offspring?
The following antihypertensive agents are used in pregnancy except:
Which is true of Hepatitis B in pregnancy?

answer.text: Breastfeeding is always contraindicated in women who are chronic carriers of HBV.
Non-immune mothers should not be vaccinated after the second trimester.
The risk of fetal infection is higher if maternal infection occurs in the third trimester.
Only infants with HBV positive mothers should be vaccinated.

questiontext.text: Which of the following vitamins, when combined with the antihistamine doxylamine, has been found to be helpful in cases of nausea and vomiting?
Kelainan kromosom seperti trisomi 21 terjadi pada fase ?
Methods of prenatal testing for congenital abnormalities – which of the following are true?

answer.text: Nuchal translucency (the space between skin and soft tissue overlying the cervical spine), measured between 11 and 13+6 weeks, is a screening test for chromosomal abnormalities such as trisomy 18.
When the fetus has an open neural tube defect (NTD), maternal serum AFP levels are usually raised. As such, this can be used as a diagnostic test for NTD.
Amniocentesis is safer than CVS before 12 weeks.
Structural abnormalities are usually diagnosed at 12 weeks at the ‘anomaly scan’.
Chorionic villus sampling (CVS) usually allows an abnormal fetus to be identified at 16 weeks.

questiontext.text: Which of the following is true in regards to Toxoplasmosis?

answer.text: Indoor cats are not reservoirs for Toxoplasmosis.
Only HIV positive women should be screened for Toxoplasma.
15% of reproductive age women have antibodies to Toxoplasmosis.
Spiramycin may reduce risk of fetal transmission.
ALL of the above are TRUE

questiontext.text: Your patient is a 40-year-old G3P2 obese woman at 37 weeks gestation. Her pregnancy has been complicated by insulin-requiring gestational diabetes. Her most recent Hgb A1c was 6.0. The patient reports that her fasting and postprandial sugars have all been within normal range. Her fetus has an estimated weight of 2950 grams by Leopolds today. All of the following are correct ways to manage this patient except

answer.text: The patient should undergo an elective cesarean section at 38 weeks to avoid shoulder dystocia
The patient should be induced by 40 weeks if spontaneous labor does not occur
After 6 weeks postpartum, the patient should undergo a 75-g glucose tolerance test
In the postpartum period, it is acceptable to use oral contraceptives
A glucose infusion will be given to the patient in labor

questiontext.text: A 25 year old nulliparous patient with HIV wishes to become pregnant. Which of the following is true?

answer.text: Even with appropriate antiretroviral therapy, neonatal infection occurs 20-25% of the time.
Fetal scalp electrode monitoring should be avoided.
With appropriate antiretroviral therapy, breastfeeding is safe in these patients.
If the mother is untreated and has a high viral load, pursue a vaginal delivery

questiontext.text: A 32-year-old woman primigravida who is 34 weeks pregnant attends the antenatal clinic complaining of severe itching.Serum bile acids are found to be elevated and she is diagnosed with obstetric cholestasis.What is the most effective medication to improve her itching?
According to WHO, anemia in pregnancy is diagnosed, when hemoglobin is less than :
Ascending infection of the vagina can induce premature labour. Which pathogen ismost commonly associated with bacterial vaginosis ?
A women with severe ankle sprain was prescribed ibuprofen for 72 hours. At what gestational age should she avoid this medication?
Commonenst congenital malformation in infant of a diabetic mother is :
You are asked to update your unit guidelines on antenatal aspirin. Which of the following patients should have aspirin 75 mg daily from 12weeks’ gestation?

answer.text: 23-year-old primigravida with a BMI of 36 at booking.
32-year-old para 1 whose mother developed preeclampsia at 27 weeks gestation
34-year-old para 1 with a BMI of 34 at booking who developed gestational diabetes in her previous  pregnancy.
39-year-old para 1 (previous unexplained stillbirth at 36 weeks’ gestation
39-year-old para 1 (who delivered an SGA baby at 35 weeks, 12 years ago

questiontext.text: With reference to iron deficiency anaemia in pregnancy, except?

answer.text: Iron demand in pregnancy increases to 4 mg per day.
High levels of serum ferritin confirm the diagnosis.
It is more common in multiple pregnancy.
It is usually treated with oral iron.

questiontext.text: Which of the following autoantibodies are specific for lupus?

A patient presents for preconceptional counseling with a history of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). She was diagnose as an plescent but has one well during the past few years an is currently in remission. Following counseling, the patient would like to pursue pregnancy. What is the most common complication that she will likely encounter uring her pregnancy?
Ninety-five percent of patients with systemic lupus erythematosus experience all EXCEPT which of the following clinical manifestations?
What condition is described by a low serum free thyroxine level and normal thyroid-stimulating hormone values?
An increased incidence of which of the following pregnancy outcomes have been linked with maternal subclinical hypothyroidism?
Ms. Smith is diagnosed with gestational diabetes that is controlled solely with diet. Which of the following are important for the management of her pregnancy at term?

answer.text:
Cesarean delivery if the estimated fetal weight is

4250 g

questiontext.text: Which of the following reflects the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists (ACOG) recommendations concerning activity in gravidas with gestational diabetes?

answer.text:
Maintenance of the same exercise routine

established before conception

questiontext.text: The incidence of stillbirth is highest in pregnancies complicated by which of the following?

Reported by Landon (2009), the Maternal-Fetal Medicine Units Network evaluated women with mild gestational diabetes, defined as a fasting blood glucose level > 95 mg/dL. Compared with women receiving only standard obstetrical care, those receiving dietary counseling and glucose monitoring had decrease
Results from randomized controlled trials suggest what benefit is gained from low-dose aspirin use during pregnancy in women with chronic hypertension?

A 30-year-old G3P2 presents for prenatal care. Her prior pregnancies have both been complicated by mild gestational hypertension near term. She is currently 12 weeks pregnant, and her blood pressure is 146/88 mm Hg. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in her management?
Compared with normal-weight patients, obese women have increased rates of all EXCEPT which of the following?
Regarding cesarean delivery in obese women, which of the following should be done to reduce the chances of wound disruption?
The rate of which of the following is not increased in fetuses of obese pregnant women?

A pregnant patient with chronic hypertension develops superimposed preeclampsia. She is diagnosed with pulmonary edema on the first postpartum day. Which of the following statements regarding this complication is true?

answer.text: Her edema may be related to increased capillary permeability.

Brain natriuretic peptide levels are less

informative in pregnant patients compared with

levels in nonpregnant patients.

questiontext.text: What is the best way to increase oxygen delivery to peripheral tissues in an obstetrical patient with hemorrhage that is complicated by acute respiratory distress syndrome?

answer.text:
Oxygen therapy to increase arterial Po2 to

200 mm Hg

questiontext.text: The recipient cotwin in a monochorionic twin gestation affected by twin-twin transfusion syndrome may experience all EXCEPT which of the following neonatal complications?
Which of the following is the most important predictor of neurological outcome of the survivor after death of a cotwin?

answer.text:
Length of time between demise and delivery of

survivor

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is true in twinreversed- arterial-perfusion (TRAP) sequence?

answer.text:
The donor is at risk of cardiomegaly and highoutput

heart failure.

The most effective treatment is injection of KCl

into the recipient twin.

Placental arterial perfusion pressure in the

recipient exceeds that of the donor.

questiontext.text: Compared with singleton pregnancies, multifetal gestations have a higher risk of all EXCEPT which of the following complications?
Which of the following is true regarding oligohydramnios?

answer.text:
It is associated with a higher cesarean delivery

rate.

questiontext.text: Which of the following sonographic assessments of fetal-growth restriction is the most predictive of obstetrical outcome?

answer.text:
Biometric growth < 3rd percentile and abnormal

umbilical artery Doppler velocimetry results

Biometric growth < 5th percentile and absent

end-diastolic flow noted during umbilical artery

Doppler velocimetry study

questiontext.text: Seorang perempuan, 35 tahun, G2P1A0, dengan usia kehamilan 10 minggu datang ke poliklinik untuk memeriksakan kehamilannya. Ibu cemas karena kehamilannya yang pertama bayi lahir dengan kelainan bawaan lahir dan akhirnya meninggal. Dari anamnesis didapatkan bahwa ayah kandung dari ibu meninggal karena penyakit ginjal akibat komplikasi penyakit kencing manis. Pada pemeriksaan fisik : tanda vital dalam batas normal, sklera dan ikterus kesan normal. Pemeriksaan apakah yang perlu dilakukan pada ibu sebagai metode skrining pada kasus ini ?

Seorang perempuan, 35 tahun, G2P1A0, dengan usia kehamilan 10 minggu datang ke poliklinik untuk memeriksakan kehamilannya. Ibu cemas karena kehamilannya yang pertama bayi lahir dengan kelainan bawaan lahir dan akhirnya meninggal. Dari anamnesis didapatkan bahwa ayah kandung dari ibu meninggal karena penyakit ginjal akibat komplikasi penyakit kencing manis. Pada pemeriksaan fisik : tanda vital dalam batas normal, sklera dan ikterus kesan normal. Jika hasil uji pemeriksaan penunjang lanjutan bernilai di atas nilai ambang, apakah diagnosis paling tepat dari kasus di atas ?

Seorang perempuan, 35 tahun, G2P1A0, dengan usia kehamilan 10 minggu datang ke poliklinik untuk memeriksakan kehamilannya. Ibu cemas karena kehamilannya yang pertama bayi lahir dengan kelainan bawaan lahir dan akhirnya meninggal. Dari anamnesis didapatkan bahwa ayah kandung dari ibu meninggal karena penyakit ginjal akibat komplikasi penyakit kencing manis. Pada pemeriksaan fisik : tanda vital dalam batas normal, sklera dan ikterus kesan normal. Masuk dalam kategori apakah kasus tersebut, berdasarkan selective screening criteria?

Seorang perempuan, 20 tahun, G1P0A0, dengan usia kehamilan 20 minggu 4 hari datang ke Puskesmas untuk memeriksakan kehamilannya. Ibu membawa hasil pemeriksaan USG yang dilakukan 2 hari sebelumnya : kehamilan kembar dua, intrauterin, hidup, dengan jenis kelamin Fetus 1 laki-laki dan Fetus 2 perempuan dalam keadaan normal. Berdasarkan hasil temuan USG, diagnosis apa yang paling mungkin untuk kasus ini ?

Seorang perempuan, 25 tahun, G2P1A0, dengan usia kehamilan 28 minggu 2 hari datang ke Puskesmas untuk kunjungan ketiga memeriksakan kehamilannya. Riwayat anak pertama lahir dengan berat badan 4200 gram. Kadar gula darah skrining : puasa 112 mg/dL, 1 jam TTGO 195 mg/dL, 2 jam TTGO 165 mg/dL.

Perempuan, 29 tahun, G1P0A0, dengan usia kehamilan 12 minggu datang ke Klinik dengan keluhan demam disertai ruam makulopapuler dimulai dari wajah kemudian ke seluruh tubuh dan anggota gerak. Hasil pemeriksaan antibodi IgM Rubella positif. Komplikasi jangka panjang apakah yang dapat terjadi pada janin dari ibu ini ?

Seorang perempuan, 22 tahun, G1P0A0, usia kehamilan 36-37 minggu, datang ke Puskesmas dengan keluhan demam, sakit kepala dan malaise. Riwayat luka di vagina sejak 6 minggu lalu, tidak nyeri. Pemeriksaan fisik : ruam kulit papula-skuomosa di telapak tangan dan telapak kaki, papul mengalami ulkus dengan dasar ulkus bersih di vagina, teraba pembesaran kelenjar inguinal bilateral. 1. Pemeriksaan penunjang apakah yang paling tepat untuk menegakkan diagnosis kasus ini?

Perempuan, 22 tahun, G1P0A0, usia kehamilan 36-37 minggu, datang ke Puskesmas dengan keluhan demam, sakit kepala dan malaise. Riwayat luka di vagina sejak 6 minggu lalu, tidak nyeri. Pemeriksaan fisik : ruam kulit papula-skuomosa di telapak tangan dan telapak kaki, papul mengalami ulkus dengan dasar ulkus bersih di vagina, teraba pembesaran kelenjar inguinal bilateral. Apa etiologi kasus ini?

Perempuan, 22 tahun, G1P0A0, usia kehamilan 36-37 minggu, datang ke Puskesmas dengan keluhan demam, sakit kepala dan malaise. Riwayat luka di vagina sejak 6 minggu lalu, tidak nyeri. Pemeriksaan fisik : ruam kulit papula-skuomosa di telapak tangan dan telapak kaki, papul mengalami ulkus dengan dasar ulkus bersih di vagina, teraba pembesaran kelenjar inguinal bilateral. Apakah antibiotik paling tepat untuk kasus ini?

Perempuan, 22 tahun, G1P0A0, usia kehamilan 36-37 minggu, datang ke Puskesmas dengan keluhan demam, sakit kepala dan malaise. Riwayat luka di vagina sejak 6 minggu lalu, tidak nyeri. Pemeriksaan fisik : ruam kulit papula-skuomosa di telapak tangan dan telapak kaki, papul mengalami ulkus dengan dasar ulkus bersih di vagina, teraba pembesaran kelenjar inguinal bilateral. Komplikasi apa yang dapat terjai pada bayi?

Seorang perempuan, 35 tahun, G2P1A0, dengan usia kehamilan 10 minggu datang ke poliklinik untuk memeriksakan kehamilannya. Ibu cemas karena kehamilannya yang pertama bayi lahir dengan kelainan bawaan lahir dan akhirnya meninggal. Dari anamnesis didapatkan bahwa ayah kandung dari ibu meninggal karena penyakit ginjal akibat komplikasi penyakit kencing manis. Pada pemeriksaan fisik : tanda vital dalam batas normal, sklera dan ikterus kesan normal. Pemeriksaan apakah yang perlu dilakukan pada ibu sebagai metode skrining pada kasus ini ? - Copy
